channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [MAHOUT-1616] Better support for hadoop dependencies of multiple versions
item.summary: Better support for hadoop dependencies of multiple versions

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
Github user gcapan closed the pull request at:

https://github.com/apache/mahout/pull/54

GitHub user gcapan reopened a pull request:

https://github.com/apache/mahout/pull/54

MAHOUT-1616 Hadoop client

I changed the hadoop related dependencies in the project root and mrlegacy to hadoop-client.

Now to build mahout against to hadoop 1.2.1, run `mvn clean package`
For another version of hadoop, try `mvn clean package -Dhadoop.version=YOUR_HADOOP_VERSION`

Tests pass, but I currently don't have access to an actual cluster. Could somebody please test this on a cluster and report the results?

This would allow us to automatically support multiple hadoop versions, including vendors', and would result in simpler poms.
If it works, I will change mahout-spark module accordingly.

You can merge this pull request into a Git repository by running:

$ git pull https://github.com/gcapan/mahout hadoop-client

Alternatively you can review and apply these changes as the patch at:

https://github.com/apache/mahout/pull/54.patch

To close this pull request, make a commit to your master/trunk branch
with (at least) the following in the commit message:

This closes #54

commit ab2d1c207829799cb79e826f97c132a3786d37ec
Author: Gokhan <gkhncpn@gmail.com>
Date: 2014-09-26T09:17:57Z

changing various hadoop dependencies to hadoop-client

commit e8b7b17b00a65f481969cf2f86f11790b07f7ada
Author: Gokhan <gkhncpn@gmail.com>
Date: 2014-09-26T09:18:26Z

Merge branch 'master' of https://git-wip-us.apache.org/repos/asf/mahout into hadoop-client

commit 56d78c0e7b387f105c2d8812ef18768549a2746e
Author: Gokhan <gkhncpn@gmail.com>
Date: 2014-09-26T09:28:44Z

taking back the changes in mahout-spark and leaving this for further discussion

Github user pferrel commented on the pull request:

https://github.com/apache/mahout/pull/54#issuecomment-58805560

Sounds much more like what Spark does but shouldn't the latest stable hadoop 2 be the default, not 1.2.1?
I think this will be a great change. I'll see if I can carve out some time to test it on our Cloudera-based cluster and provide some feedback.

Github user gcapan commented on the pull request:

https://github.com/apache/mahout/pull/54#issuecomment-61022884

I updated the patch such that hadoop 2.2.0 is the default now, and CDH and MapR repos are in the repository list. I also commented out (for now) the profile descriptions in mahout-spark module.

Could you guys please try this on your clusters and report the results?

`mvn clean package` builds for hadoop 2.2.0
Or try `mvn clean package -Dhadoop.version=YOUR_HADOOP_VERSION`

Github user pferrel commented on the pull request:

https://github.com/apache/mahout/pull/54#issuecomment-61193383

ok, I'll merge with the master, which is on Spark 1.1 and try it on my hadoop 1.2.1 cluster. If that doesn't confuse things nothing will.

Github user pferrel commented on the pull request:

https://github.com/apache/mahout/pull/54#issuecomment-61200459

I'm getting the snappy build test error that broke the nightly build. Switching back to master and trying again

Github user dlyubimov commented on the pull request:

https://github.com/apache/mahout/pull/54#issuecomment-61210738

oh.

that's hadoop versioning thing then again.

keep in mind – hadoop version in maven dependencies is not the same as
actual hadoop version spark has at runtime.

in fact, spark modules are pulling hadoop version from spark transitive
dependencies as compiled in your local maven.

by default nightly will pool the default spark artifact from central, which
will have whatever default hadoop version there, which is what most likely
spark module is going to use for local tests. but generally it shouldn't
matter which hadoop version spark tests are running on, because they are
not writing/reading files created with any other version.

On Thu, Oct 30, 2014 at 6:23 PM, Pat Ferrel <notifications@github.com>
wrote:

> I'm getting the snappy build test error that broke the nightly build.
> Switching back to master and trying again
>
> —
> Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHub
> <https://github.com/apache/mahout/pull/54#issuecomment-61200459>.
>

Github user gcapan commented on the pull request:

https://github.com/apache/mahout/pull/54#issuecomment-61258378

Alright, I am confused a little.

@Pat, doest this patch break the build or it also occurs when packaging the
master?

@Dmitriy,
My rationale is that, as it is suggested at
http://spark.apache.org/docs/latest/programming-guide.html#linking-with-spark,
mahout, as a hadoop client, should add hadoop-client and spark_core as a
dependency and then just work. The version of hadoop-client should support
multiple hadoop versions since people might have hadoop clusters with
different versions, from different vendors etc.

Gokhan

I think this is the problem.

If that works, perhaps we need to add a hadoop profile for v1 and update those classifiers accordingly when it is selected.

No problem- let me know if you want me to run any more tests.

Github user gcapan commented on the pull request:

https://github.com/apache/mahout/pull/54#issuecomment-61425368

There is an unpleasant change.
To package mahout with:

  • hadoop 2.2.0 dependency, run `mvn package`
  • any other hadoopv2 dependency, run `mvn package -Dhadoop.version=YOUR_HADOOP_VERSION`
  • a hadoopv1 dependency, run `mvn package -Dhadoop.version=YOUR_HADOOP_VERSION -Phadoop1`

Github user gcapan commented on the pull request:

https://github.com/apache/mahout/pull/54#issuecomment-61461728

I'm gonna commit this later today, after performing a couple more tests

`

Github user asfgit closed the pull request at:

https://github.com/apache/mahout/pull/54

SUCCESS: Integrated in Mahout-Quality #2852 (See https://builds.apache.org/job/Mahout-Quality/2852/)
MAHOUT-1616 Better support for hadoop dependencies. Now Apache Mahout's default hadoop version is 2.2.0, and we handle hadoop dependencies via hadoop-client artifact. This closes apache/mahout#54 (gkhncpn: rev f1095d8c30d33e0e86e691f797d13c6f7bc11c4c)

  • integration/pom.xml
  • spark/pom.xml
  • math-scala/src/test/scala/org/apache/mahout/math/decompositions/DistributedDecompositionsSuiteBase.scala
  • pom.xml
  • mrlegacy/pom.xml
  • h2o/pom.xml
